headline.main: Golda Meir: Peace and Arab Acceptance Were Goals of Her 5 Years as Premier; Preferred the 'Tough Old Lady' She Ran Away to Her Sister No Oil and Too Much Sand Innovations Finally Won Favor Raging At Calm Amid Suffering One of the Few Not Arrested Money to House the Refugees Planner of the Suez Operation Golda Meir: Biggest Crisis of Her Career in Israel Was the Arab Attack in October 1973 No Joy in Being Good Soldiers Doves and Hawks but No Pigeons Ready to Go Anywhere for Peace Telling the Pope How It Was Too Apprehensive for Tears

snippet: For five years Golda Meir was Prime Minister of Israel. Her often-stated ambition was to see Israel accepted by its Arab neighbors and living in peace.
